rules.rule_text: All abstracts that coincides with disease area of interest (IgAN).
rules.reasoning: This rule defines relevance based on the presence of the keyword for the specified disease of interest.
This priority is assigned manually by the client team and cannot be automated based on abstract content.

rules.rule_text: All relevant abstracts that include any of the following: Phase 2/3 data (including meta-analyses), real-world data (including patient reported outcomes, retrospective analyses and registry data).
rules.reasoning: This rule requires identifying specific study types and data sources (Phase 2/3, real-world data, PROs) which are contextual concepts, not direct client keywords.
This rule prioritizes studies sponsored by Calliditas. This is implemented by searching for the company name 'Calliditas' or its known clinical trials and drug names.

rules.rule_text: All relevant abstracts that include any of the following: Phase 1 data, general HEOR studies, prognostic studies, preclinical studies, other general studies.
rules.reasoning: This rule requires identifying specific study types (Phase 1, HEOR, prognostic, preclinical) which are contextual concepts, not direct client keywords.

rules.rule_text: All relevant abstracts that only have mention of an indication of interest and does not meet any higher priority criteria.
rules.reasoning: This is a default priority for abstracts that are relevant but do not meet the criteria for Internal, High, or Medium priority. It is applied logically after other rules have been evaluated and does not have its own include logic.
